RT @Alyssa_Milano Senator @CoryBooker introduced a bill with @SenSherrodBrown that would end the unfair banking practice of overdraft fees that often hurt the most vulnerable. #ForThePeople https://twitter.com/corybooker/status/1025452401996771328 QT @CoryBooker Overdraft fees fall on those least able to afford them & can push vulnerable consumers over the financial brink.  @SenSherrodBrown & I just introduced a bill to end these unfair banking practices that trap so many in a vicious cycle of poverty. https://www.vox.com/2018/8/2/17640068/cory-booker-bank-overdraft-fees

In 99% of counties in the US., a minimum wage worker working 40 hrs/wk cannot afford a 1-bedroom apartment at fair market rate. That’s why I introduced the #RentReliefAct, so if you’re paying 30%+ of your income on rent, you’ll get back some of your money back to cover expenses.

The federal minimum wage→
April 1, 1990: $3.80
April 1, 1991: $4.25
October 1, 1996: $4.75 
September 1, 1997: $5.15 
July 24, 2007: $5.85 
July 24, 2008: $6.55 
July 24, 2009: $7.25 

It’s now 2018. Time to raise the wage.
